page.title: 16Low Harperley Farm.
page.content: Low Harperley Farm is just inside the area we had to study.It is a large farm with a number of buildings.The cows and sheep are reared for their meat and the land is left for grazing.Some of the fields are used for crops mainly barley and hay. The farmhouse is reached by private road and is surrounded by a large stone wall. The farmhouse has three large stacks of chimneys and an open barn for storing the bales of hay.A large cylinder stands nearby which is used to store crops,it is called a cropstore.Next to this is the covered in barn where some of the animals stay during winter.Behind the barn are some old stables used as a store area and these have small openings in the wall for doves long ago.
